message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think you'll really love it. Would you like to buy it from me for $250?
I'm interested in the product, but $250 is a bit steep for me. I was thinking more along the lines of $180. Would you be willing to meet me in the middle?
I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob. However, I have to make a profit on this sale. I can offer you a price of $220, which is a compromise between our previous offers. What do you think?
I'm still interested in the product, but I really think $220 is a bit too high. I'm willing to pay $190 for it. Can you meet me at this price?

I appreciate your persistence, Bob! I can see you're really interested in the product. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $190 and $220, so I can offer you $205. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate the effort to meet me in the middle, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to pay $195 for the product. Can you consider this price?

I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob! I can see you're really interested in the product. I'm willing to take a slightly smaller margin, so I can offer you $200. It's my final offer, so I hope you'll consider it.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still not comfortable with $200. I'm willing to pay $185 for the product. This is my final offer, I'm not willing to go any lower.

I've already made a few concessions, Bob, and I'm not willing to go any lower than my previous offer of $200. I think that's a fair price considering the product's value. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'm afraid I'll have to consider other options.

I understand you're not willing to go any lower than $200, but I'm still not comfortable with that price. I'm willing to walk away from the deal if I don't get a better price. I'll give you one last chance to meet me at $185. If not, I'll buy it from John for $120.
